result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric D. Slocum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling/combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances unless prescribed and only within that prescribed amount.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Counseling as recommended.  AODA and follow up.  

DNA sample.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination.
Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances.

DNA sample.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended.

AODA and Follow up.

Payment of financial obligations.

miscConds.notes: GFE at full time employment/schooling or combination.
Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  DNA sample.  AODA and any follow up.

supervisions.notes: with huber for work/school/treatment/community service or a combination.  NO objection to EMP.
